p: It might appear very hard to make dietary recommendations that are equally suitable for those living in large cities in the USA as well as those living in urban societies in Africa. However, the ‘Westernization’ of diets and the pervasiveness of fast, convenience foods make the diets of such diverged societies much more similar now than they were 30 years ago. Oily fried food and high-sugar drinks are likely to be major constituents of both, and yet these are foods that are of low nutritional quality, devoid of many phytonutrients, and fuel chronic disease.
